choices.D: It is not possible to have the same IAM account login URL for separate AWS accounts
choices.C: Create the same account alias with each account ID
choices.B: Create the S3 bucket with an alias name and use the redirect rule to forward requests to various accounts
choices.A: Merge all the accounts with consolidated billing

questions.question_text:
ABC has three AWS accounts. They have created separate IAM users within each account.
ABC wants a single IAM login URL such as https://abc.signin.aws.amazon.com/console/ for use by IAM users in all three accounts.
How can this be achieved?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Each AWS account has its own unique IAM login URL. The URL follows the format: https://your-account-id.signin.aws.amazon.com/console/. The account ID is unique to each AWS account and cannot be shared or merged with other accounts.

Selected Answer: D
D, by motives of security, not is possible access with other account with user de other account!
My vote goes to D.

I would say D. The link provided in the solution seems upfront.
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/AccountAlias.html
A seems right

questions.answer_description:
Users can create an alias for they accounts, but the alias should be unique to the account. For example, the alias "abc" can be assigned to only one account. If a user wants the URL of the AWS IAM sign-in page to have a company name instead of the AWS account ID, he can create an alias for his AWS account ID.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/AccountAlias.html

choices.C: Use DirectConnect between EC2 and S3
choices.D: Use EBS PIOPS on the local volume

B. as a larger instance will be able to handle higher throughput

Selected Answer: B
B - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/enhanced-networking-ena.html
Take advantage of advanced networking, via ENA. To do this, you will need a larger instance type.

B Is the Answer

A larger instance would bring more network bandwidth
I totally agree with answer B
B. as a larger instance will be able to handle higher throughput

questions.question_text:
You have identified network throughput as a bottleneck on your m1.small EC2 instance when uploading data Into Amazon S3 In the same region.
How do you remedy this situation?

discussion.content: A is correct. Only snapshot. If you want volume in another az then, you have to create new vol from the existing snapshot and copy into another az.

comments.content: Yes ! A is the best answer !

discussion.content: A. Take periodic snapshots of the EBS volume
Correct Answer: A

A is the answer

Take regular snapshots, then copy it to the AZ and restore the volume

discussion.content:
D. Create another EBS volume in the second Availability Zone attach it to the Amazon EC2 instance,

questions.answer_description:
EBS volumes can only be attached to EC2 instances within the same Availability Zone.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ebs-restoring-volume.html

choices.B: Use a third party Incremental backup application to back up to Amazon Glacier
choices.C: Periodically back up all data to a single compressed archive and archive to Amazon S3 using a parallelized multi-part upload
choices.D: Create another EBS volume in the second Availability Zone attach it to the Amazon EC2 instance, and use a disk manager to mirror me two disks
choices.A: Take periodic snapshots of the EBS volume

questions.question_text:
You have a server with a 5O0GB Amazon EBS data volume. The volume is 80% full. You need to back up the volume at regular intervals and be able to re-create the volume in a new Availability Zone in the shortest time possible. All applications using the volume can be paused for a period of a few minutes with no discernible user impact.
Which of the following backup methods will best fulfill your requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The "aws:CurrentTime" policy key in AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is used to set date and time conditions for granting or denying access. This key allows you to specify conditions based on the current date and time, such as allowing access only during specific time ranges or on specific days. It is commonly used to enforce time-based access controls in IAM policies.
correct answer A

questions.answer_description:
AWS Direct Connect implements the following policy keys of Identity and Access Management: aws:CurrentTime (for date/time conditions) aws:EpochTime (the date in epoch or UNIX time, for use with date/time conditions) aws:SecureTransport (Boolean representing whether the request was sent using SSL) aws:SourceIp (the requester's IP address, for use with IP address conditions) aws:UserAgent (in-formation about the requester's client application, for use with string conditions)
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/directconnect/latest/UserGuide/using_iam.html
questions.question_text: Which of the following Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy keys of AWS Direct Con-nect is used for date/time conditions?

questions.answer_description:
Amazon RDS leverages the same secure infrastructure as Amazon EC2. You can use the Amazon RDS service without additional protection, but if you require encryption or data integrity authenti-cation of data at rest for compliance or other purposes, you can add protection at the application layer, or at the platform layer using SQL cryptographic functions.
Reference:
https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/aws-security-best-practices.pdf

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In the context of AWS Security Best Practices for RDS (Amazon Relational Database Service), if you require encryption or data integrity authentication of data at rest, you can add protection at the application layer using SQL cryptographic functions.

questions.question_text: In the context of AWS Security Best Practices for RDS, if you require encryption or data integrity authentication of data at rest for compliance or other purposes, you can add protection at the _____ using SQL cryptographic functions.
